article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
title: Migrant Transfer to Guantánamo Bay
description: The Trump administration sent dozens of Venezuelan migrants to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, where they are being guarded by troops rather than civilian immigration officers.

article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
title: Lawsuit Filed for Migrant Detainee Access to Lawyers
description: Legal aid organizations sued the Trump administration, seeking access to lawyers for migrants taken to Guantánamo Bay to challenge their detention.

article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
title: Expansion of Migrant Operations Center at Guantánamo Bay
description: The U.S. Southern Command has been streaming staff and support personnel to Guantánamo Bay since Trump's order on January 29 to prepare to expand a migrant operations center at Guantánamo Bay.

article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?
title: Claim that Gina Haspel ran a CIA black site at Guantánamo
description: Rita Radostitz, a lawyer for Khalid Sheik Mohammed, claimed in a secret hearing that CIA Director Gina Haspel ran a secret CIA outpost at Guantánamo, an apparent reference to a post-9/11 black site.

article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?
title: CIA operated two black sites at Guantánamo
description: The CIA allegedly operated two black sites at Guantánamo, code named Maroon and Indigo, from September 2003 to April 2004.

article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?
title: Transfer of 9/11 conspirators to Guantánamo
description: The CIA sent the alleged 9/11 conspirators and other “high-value detainees” to military detention at Guantánamo.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: Defense attorney threatens hearing boycott
description: Khalid Sheik Mohammed's attorney threatened to boycott this week's pretrial hearing due to the FBI questioning a former 9/11 defense team paralegal.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: FBI questioning of paralegal
description: FBI questioned a former 9/11 defense team paralegal, Army Staff Sgt. Brent Skeete, at Fort Hood, Texas, over three days last month about defense team dynamics.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: Judge reassures defense lawyers
description: New judge Marine Col. Keith Parrella sought to reassure defense lawyers that none of them were under federal investigation.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: Judge meets with DOJ lawyers
description: Parrella met with special Justice Department 9/11 case lawyers to hear about the Skeete interview and ruled that current, active 9/11 defense team members are not under federal investigation.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: Attorneys request judge removal
description: Mohammed’s attorneys are asking a federal court to remove Parrella from the case because he has worked at the National Security Division of the Department of Justice.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: DOJ to provide written declarations
description: Justice Department lawyers to provide defense attorneys with written declarations that say they are not under investigation.

article_title: Sept. 11 defense lawyers threaten hearing boycott over FBI interview of paralegal
title: Intelligence agency investigations
description: Rolling intelligence agency investigations of himself and his team since 2009

article_title: 9/11 plea deal includes lifetime gag order on CIA torture secrets
title: 9/11 Plea Deal Includes Gag Order on CIA Torture Secrets
description: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed agreed to never disclose secret aspects of his torture by the CIA if he is allowed to plead guilty rather than face a death-penalty trial. The agreement includes a lifetime gag order on CIA torture secrets.

article_title: 9/11 plea deal includes lifetime gag order on CIA torture secrets
title: Defense Secretary withdraws from plea agreement
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin III withdrew from a plea agreement with Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other men accused of conspiring in the 9/11 attacks. A three-judge panel is considering whether this withdrawal was lawful.

article_title: 9/11 plea deal includes lifetime gag order on CIA torture secrets
title: Appeals court extends order preventing plea proceedings
description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit extended an order preventing the military judge at Guantánamo from holding plea proceedings in the case.
